revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=July 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2017}} {{Chinese name|[[Liu|Low]]}} {{Infobox person | name = Jho Low | image = | alt = | caption = | native_name = 刘特佐 | native_name_lang = zh | birth_name = Low Taek Jho | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1981|11|4|df=y}} | birth_place = [[George Town, Penang]], Malaysia | death_date = | death_place = | residence = Hong Kong | nationality = Malaysian | other_names = | alma_mater = [[Harrow School]]
[[Wharton Business School]] | occupation = Businessman | years_active = | known_for = | parents = | relatives = Low Meng Tak (grandfather) Larry Low Hock Peng (father) | website = {{url|http://www.jho-low.com/}} (Inactive) }} '''Low Taek Jho''' ({{zh|s=刘特佐|sl=Lau4 Dak1 Joh3|p=Liú Tèzuǒ}}, born 4 November 1981), often called '''Jho Low''', is a fugitive{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/10/09/moles-in-govt-tipping-off-jho-low-claims-daim/|title=Moles in govt tipping off Jho Low, claims Daim|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} wanted by the Malaysian authorities in connection to the [[1MDB scandal]]. He is the beneficiary of numerous discretionary trust assets said by the US Government to originate from payments out of the Malaysian [[1MDB]] fund.{{Cite web|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/business/companies-markets/singapore-seizes-240m-in-assets-in-1mdb-probe-half-from-malaysian|title=Singapore seizes $240m in assets in 1MDB probe, half from flamboyant Malaysian financier Jho Low and family|last=hermesauto|date=21 July 2016|access-date=28 July 2016}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/in-properties-targeted-in-1mdb-case-a-high-end-house-tour-1469057628|title=In Properties Targeted in 1MDB Case, a High-End House Tour|last=Karp|first=Hannah|date=20 July 2016|last2=Grant|first2=Peter|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal|issn=0099-9660|access-date=28 July 2016}}{{Cite web|url=https://bol.bna.com/fund-lawyer-who-worked-with-goldman-holds-1mdb-clues-u-s-says/|title=Fund Lawyer Who Worked With Goldman Holds 1MDB Clues, U.S. Says|access-date=28 July 2016}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/malaysia-1mdb-scandal-najib-razaks-aide-jho-low-made-millions-state-run-fund-report-2355876|title=Malaysia 1MDB Scandal: Najib Razak’s Aide Jho Low Made Millions From State-Run Fund, Report Says|date=19 April 2016|access-date=28 July 2016}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/1mdb-probe-may-be-good-news-for-park-lane-hotel-investors-1469554543|title=1MDB Probe May Be Good News for Park Lane Hotel Investors|last=Grant|first=Peter|date=26 July 2016|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal|issn=0099-9660|access-date=28 July 2016}} He gained notoriety as a "tabloid party boy"Story, Louise and Stephanie Saul. "[https://www.nytimes.com/2015/02/09/nyregion/jho-low-young-malaysian-has-an-appetite-for-new-york.html Jho Low, Well Connected in Malaysia, Has an Appetite for New York]
". ''[[The New York Times]]'' 8 February 2015. in New York City. Low has been associated with numerous dubious high value transactions, including acquisitions of businesses, luxury real estate and art, as well as philanthropy. == Early life == Low grew up in [[George Town, Penang|George Town]], on [[Penang Island]]. His grandfather Low Meng Tak was a businessman born in [[Guangdong]] in China.{{Cite news|url = https://www.wsj.com/articles/scion-moves-into-spotlight-on-global-m-a-stage-1413915617|title = Scion Moves into Spotlight on M&A Stage|last = Farrell|first = Maureen|date = 21 October 2014|access-date = |newspaper = The Wall Street Journal}} Meng Tak had interests in iron-ore mining and liquor distilleries in [[Thailand]] in the 1960s and 1970s, and in real estate in Thailand, Malaysia and [[Hong Kong]]. Jho Low's father [[Malay styles and titles|Tan Sri]] Larry Low Hock Peng founded investment holding company MWE Holdings.{{cite web|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/story/?file=%2f2010%2f7%2f29%2fnation%2f6756946&sec=nation|title=A millionaire before graduating|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=29 July 2010}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2014/11/01/low-family-fortune-first-built-on-ironore-mining/|title=Low family fortune first built on iron-ore mining - Business News {{!}} The Star Online|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=2018-12-02}} Low was the youngest of three children. He attended [[Chung Ling High School]] and [[The International School of Penang (Uplands)]] before being sent to the elite [[Harrow School]] in London. In London, he developed a "close relationship" with [[Riza Aziz]], the stepson of former [[Malaysian Prime Minister]] [[Najib Razak]].Story, Louise and Stephanie Saul. "[https://www.nytimes.com/2015/02/09/nyregion/jho-low-young-malaysian-has-an-appetite-for-new-york.html Jho Low, Well Connected in Malaysia, Has an Appetite for New York]
". ''[[The New York Times]]'' 8 February 2015. "In a statement provided by a spokesman, Mr. Low...said he 'is a friend of Mr. Riza Aziz and his family.'"Story, Louise. "[https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/22/world/asia/malaysias-leader-najib-razak-faces-us-corruption-inquiry.html?action=click&contentCollection=Business%20Day&module=MostPopularFB&version=Full®ion=Marginalia&src=me&pgtype=article Malaysia’s Leader, Najib Razak, Faces U.S. Corruption Inquiry]
". ''[[The New York Times]]'' 22 September 2015. "The US Government civil cases are focused on properties in the United States that were purchased in recent years by companies that belong to the prime minister's stepson as well as other real estate connected to a close family friend" He then enrolled in the undergraduate program of the [[University of Pennsylvania]]'s [[Wharton Business School]], where he continued to develop connections with Malaysians as well as Kuwaiti and Jordanian interests and began managing money for his friends and family. Low can speak [[Malay language|Malay]], English, [[Cantonese]], [[Hokkien]] and [[Teochew dialect|Teochew]]. == Business dealings and wealth == Although earlier in his career, Low had often claimed to be investing and making purchases on behalf of other investors or "friends", in 2015 Low suggested that his family had considerable independent means. While a 2015 New York Times article suggested that his family was of "somewhat deflated affluence," a 2014 Wall Street Journal profile had called him a "scion." === Career === Low's first major deal was the [[Kuwait Finance House]]'s 2006 purchase for US$87 million of a luxury [[high-rise]] apartment building in [[Kuala Lumpur]]. According to the New York Times, "[b]y 2007, [Low] had formed an investment group that included a Malaysian prince, a Kuwaiti sheikh and a friend from the [[United Arab Emirates]] who went on to become ambassador to the United States and Mexico." By 2010, the family had consolidated its fortune into Jynwel Capital, of which Low and older brother Szen Low were the principal stewards. As steward of Jynwel, Low cultivated relationships with some of the world's largest sovereign wealth funds, including [[Abu Dhabi]]'s [[Mubadala Development Co]] and the [[Kuwait Investment Authority]].{{cite web|url=http://www.malaysia-today.net/jho-low-back-in-the-limelight/|author=Super Admin|title=JHO LOW BACK IN THE LIMELIGHT|publisher=[[Malaysia Today]]|date=1 November 2014}} Jynwel is connected with deals including the acquisition of New York's [[Park Lane Hotel (Manhattan)|Park Lane Hotel]] for US$660 million in 2013 with The Witkoff Group and Mubadala; the takeover of Coastal Energy in 2014 for US$2.2 billion; and the buyout of [[EMI]]'s music publishing business in 2012 for US$2.2 billion with the [[Blackstone Group]], [[Sony Corporation]] and Mubadala.{{cite web|url=http://www.therakyatpost.com/business/2014/10/22/jho-low-jynwel-capital-move-global-deal-spotlight-supported-wealthy-abu-dhabi-funds/|title=Jho Low, Jynwel Capital move into global deal spotlight supported by wealthy Abu Dhabi Funds|work=The Rakyat Post|date=22 October 2014}} Low was the architect for Jynwel Capital's unsuccessful US$2.2 billion bid to buy [[Reebok]] from [[Adidas AG]] in October 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.therakyatpost.com/business/2014/10/20/abu-dhabi-bid-reebok/|title=Jynwel Capital, led by Jho Low, and Abu Dhabi Funds seek to buy Reebok from Adidas|work=The Rakyat Post|date=20 October 2014}} Low advises Aziz in the management of [[Red Granite Pictures]], a Hollywood production company responsible for films such as ''[[The Wolf of Wall Street (2013 film)|Wolf of Wall Street]]'' and ''[[Dumb and Dumber To]]''.Story, Louise and Stephanie Saul. "[https://www.nytimes.com/2015/02/09/nyregion/jho-low-young-malaysian-has-an-appetite-for-new-york.html Jho Low, Well Connected in Malaysia, Has an Appetite for New York]
". ''[[The New York Times]]'' 8 February 2015. "With Mr. Low's help, Mr. Aziz runs a Hollywood company that produced the films 'The Wolf of Wall Street' and 'Dumb and Dumber To.'" Recovery of the rights in both movies were the subject of actions for recovery by the US Government in 2013 and 2016, respectively, as procured from the alleged proceeds of misappropriation of funds.{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-06-15/u-s-seeks-to-recover-540-million-tied-to-tainted-1mdb-fund|title=1MDB Loot Included Picasso, 'Dumb and Dumber To,' U.S. Says|date=15 June 2017|last=Farrel|first=Greg|publisher=Bloomberg LP|access-date=22 June 2017}} === 1MDB allegations === {{main|1Malaysia Development Berhad scandal}} Najib Razak gained the post of Malaysian Prime Minister in 2009. Soon, he became president of the board of advisers for [[1MDB]], the Malaysian sovereign wealth fund. Although Low never received an official position, he admits that he occasionally "consulted" with 1MDB, and was involved in a number of transactions connecting his own interests with those of 1MDB.{{Cite news|title = Malaysian Financier Jho Low Tied to 1MDB Inquiry|url = https://www.wsj.com/articles/malaysian-financier-tied-to-inquiry-into-1mdb-1436466499|newspaper = The Wall Street Journal|date = 9 July 2015|access-date = 11 July 2015|issn = 0099-9660|first = Tom|last = Wright}} The ''[[Wall Street Journal]]'' has reported that a $33.5 million condominium in [[Manhattan]] was owned by a shell company under control of Low's family trust, and then was transferred to a shell company controlled by Razak's stepson.Story, Louise. "[https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/22/world/asia/malaysias-leader-najib-razak-faces-us-corruption-inquiry.html?action=click&contentCollection=Business%20Day&module=MostPopularFB&version=Full®ion=Marginalia&src=me&pgtype=article Malaysia’s Leader, Najib Razak, Faces U.S. Corruption Inquiry]
". ''[[The New York Times]]'' 22 September 2015. Another "home in [[Beverly Hills]] known as the pyramid house for a gold pyramid in its garden" was owned by a shell company controlled by the Low family trust, and was transferred to Razak's stepson by simply transferring control of the shell company to him. In October 2016, [[Interpol]] published a red notice at [[Singapore]]'s request to locate Jho Low in an investigation related to 1MDB fund flows within its jurisdiction.{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/06/08/singapore-says-interpol-had-red-notice-out-on-jho-low-in-2016-malaysia-was-aware/|title=Singapore says Interpol had red notice out on Jho Low in 2016, Malaysia was aware - Nation {{!}} The Star Online|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=2018-06-08}} After the [[Malaysian general election, 2018|Malaysian general election]] in 2018, Malaysia renewed investigations into the [[1Malaysia Development Berhad scandal|1MDB scandal]] and issued arrest warrants against Low and former SRC International director, Nik Faisal Ariff Kamil.{{Cite news|url=https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/arrest-warrant-issued-for-jho-low-report|title=Arrest warrant issued for Jho Low: Report|last=hermes|date=2018-06-08|work=The Straits Times|access-date=2018-06-08|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/06/08/pm-confirms-bid-to-arrest-jho-low-but-he-cant-be-extradited/|title=PM: We know where Jho Low is, we just can’t get to him - Nation {{!}} The Star Online|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=2018-06-08}} According to [[South China Morning Post]] reports, Jho Low is still involved in affairs of his [[Hong Kong]] companies. He signed documents for private equity firm [[Jynwel Capital]] and non-profit group [[Jynwel Charitable Foundation]] in July 2018,{{Cite web|url=https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/hong-kong-law-and-crime/article/2156339/fugitive-malaysian-businessman-jho-low-still|title=Fugitive Malaysian businessman Jho Low still involved in affairs of his Hong Kong companies|last=|first=|date=22 July 2018|website=SCMP|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=23 July 2018}} even though he is on the run from Malaysian authorities looking to arrest him in connection with the 1MDB scandal.{{Cite web|url=http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/nation/2018/07/23/report-jho-low-on-the-run-but-still-involved-in-hk-companies/|title=Report: Jho Low on the run, but still involved in HK companies|last=|first=|date=23 July 2018|website=Free Malaysia Today|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=23 July 2018}} He has repeatedly tried to arrange for an immunity deal, but the Malaysian government has consistently refused him.{{citeweb|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/oct/25/1mdb-scandal-explained-a-tale-of-malaysias-missing-billions|title=1MDB scandal explained: a tale of Malaysia's missing billions|publisher=The Guardian|date=25 October 2018|accessdate=26 October 2018}} Low allegedly purchased a US$325,000 (over RM1 million) white Ferrari as a wedding gift for [[Kim Kardashian]] in 2011. {{Cite news|url=https://pagesix.com/2018/09/12/jho-low-reportedly-gave-kim-k-and-kris-humphries-a-325k-ferrari/|title=Jho Low reportedly gave Kim K. and Kris Humphries a $325K Ferrari|date=2018-09-12|work=Page Six|access-date=2018-09-14|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/nation/2018/09/13/jho-low-bought-us325000-ferrari-for-kim-kardashian-says-report/?utm_source=FMT+Media+Sdn.+Bhd.&utm_campaign=ca70f8b01d-RSS_EMAIL_CAMPAIGN&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_dfafd0994c-ca70f8b01d-214397853|title=Jho Low bought US$325,000 Ferrari for Kim Kardashian, says report|date=2018-09-13|work=Free Malaysia Today|access-date=2018-09-14|language=en-US}} The Department of Justice (DoJ) had reportedly also gone after the other famous celebrities who had received gifts from Low, among the list are [[Leonardo DiCaprio]], who has since returned the [[Picasso]] and [[Jean-Michel Basquiat|Basquiat]] paintings; and [[Miranda Kerr]] who returned diamond jewellery in the market value of US$8 million.{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/09/13/jho-low-allegedly-bought-white-ferrari-for-kim-kardashian/|title=Jho Low allegedly bought white Ferrari for Kim Kardashian - Nation {{!}} The Star Online|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=2018-09-14}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/malaysian-businessman-jho-low-allegedly-bought-white-ferrari-for-reality-tv-show-star|title=Malaysian businessman Jho Low allegedly bought white Ferrari for reality TV show star Kim Kardashian|last=hermesauto|date=2018-09-14|work=The Straits Times|access-date=2018-09-14|language=en}} In June 2017, the US Government, in civil proceedings brought against certain assets in the Central District of California, sought return of US$540 million worth of assets derived from an alleged $4.5 billion misappropriation from the Malaysian 1MDB wealth fund. On 1 November 2018, Low and two ex-[[Goldman Sachs]] bankers were charged by the [[US Department of Justice]] with money laundering in connection with the alleged 1MDB misappropriation.{{cite news |date= 1 November 2018|title= 1MDB: Ex-Goldman bankers and Jho Low face US charges|url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-46062576|work= BBC News|access-date= 1 November 2018}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/1mdb-jho-low-charges-10888910?from=groupmessage&isappinstalled=0 |title=What has Jho Low been charged with? US documents reveal extent of '1MDB fraud' |date=2018-11-02 |work=Channel NewsAsia |access-date=2018-11-02 |language=en-US}} == Politics == Consistent with his personal connections to the Razak family, Low supported the Prime Minister during the [[Malaysian general election, 2013|2013 elections]]. He organised a free pro-government concert in his home state of Penang, featuring American musicians [[Busta Rhymes]] and [[Ludacris]] and was criticised as unfair electioneering by the local, opposition government.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/02/09/nyregion/jho-low-young-malaysian-has-an-appetite-for-new-york.html|title=Jho Low, Well Connected in Malaysia, Has an Appetite for New York|last=Saul|first=Louise Story and Stephanie|access-date=2018-11-20|language=en}} == Social life == Low is romantically linked to socialite [[Paris Hilton]], Taiwanese singer [[Elva Hsiao]] and supermodel Miranda Kerr.{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-targets-540-million-of-new-assets-in-1mdb-fraud-case-1497539922|title=U.S.'s Latest Target in 1MDB Probe: Leo DiCaprio’s Art, Miranda Kerr’s Jewelry|last=Baer|first=Justin|date=15 June 2017|work=The Wall Street Journal|access-date=15 June 2017|last2=Viswanatha|first2=Aruna|language=en-US|issn=0099-9660|last3=Hope|first3=Bradley}} Low gained early notoriety by spending extravagant sums in New York and Las Vegas parties,Moylan, Brian. "[http://gawker.com/5401369/jho-low-manhattans-mysterious-big-spending-party-boy Jho Low: Manhattan's Mysterious Big-Spending Party Boy]
{{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150926022700/http://gawker.com/5401369/jho-low-manhattans-mysterious-big-spending-party-boy |date=26 September 2015 }}
26 September 2015 at the [[Wayback Machine]]. [[Category:Webarchive template wayback links]]
26 September 2015 at the [[Wayback Machine]]. [[Category:Webarchive template wayback links]] " Gawker. 10 November 2009. as well as a luxurious MYR 5.5 million boyfriend proposal to Hsiao.{{Cite web|url=https://thecoverage.my/news/malaysia-billionaire-jho-lows-rm5-5-million-failed-marriage-proposal-to-elva-hsiao/|title=Malaysia Billionaire Jho Low's RM5.5 Million Failed Marriage Proposal To Elva Hsiao - The Coverage|website=thecoverage.my|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-07}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.businessinsider.my/pop-stars-models-and-hollywood-the-crazy-life-of-jho-low-accused-of-siphoning-money-from-malaysias-state-fund-2017-8/?r=UK&IR=T|title=Pop stars, models, and Hollywood: The crazy life of the man accused of siphoning $4.5 billion from Malaysia’s state fund|last=UK|first=Camilla Hodgson, Business Insider|date=2017-08-17|work=Business Insider Malaysia|access-date=2018-06-07|language=en-US}} == Philanthropy == Low's philanthropy began after a reported cancer scare in 2012. He then founded Jynwel Foundation to honour the Low family tradition, started by his grandfather, of financing schools, hospitals and community centres in his hometown. Low's grandfather died from cancer in 2013. In 2013, Jynwel Foundation committed US$50 million over 12 years to the [[University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center]], the hospital where Jho Low spent six months recovering from his infection and cancer scare.{{cite web|url=http://www.mdanderson.org/publications/promise/issues/winter-2014/jho-low-gift.html|author=Victor Scott|title=$50 million plus world's smartest computer|publisher=[[University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center]]|accessdate=13 October 2015}} The funds were to begin a pilot program using [[IBM]]'s [[Watson (computer)|Watson]] [[question answering]] computer system as a [[clinical decision support system]] in cancer.{{Cite press release | url = https://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/42214.wss | publisher = IBM | title = MD Anderson Taps IBM Watson to Power 'Moon Shots' Mission Aimed at Ending Cancer, Starting with Leukemia}}{{Cite news | url = https://www.forbes.com/sites/bruceupbin/2013/10/18/ibms-watson-now-tackles-clinical-trials-at-md-anderson-cancer-center/ | work = Forbes | title = IBM's Watson Now Tackles Clinical Trials at MD Anderson Cancer Center}} The plan was to acquire, analyse and organise vast amounts of data to help physicians determine the most promising treatments for cancer patients.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.scientificamerican.com/mind-guest-blog/expert-cancer-care-may-soon-be-everywhere-thanks-to-watson/|author= Rob High and Jho Low|title=Expert Cancer Care May Soon Be Everywhere, Thanks to Watson|work=[[Scientific American]]|date=20 October 2014}} Low, on behalf of the Jynwel Foundation, underwrote [[Alicia Keys]]' [[Keep A Child Alive]]'s annual flagship fundraiser event in New York City from 2012 to 2015. He donated $250,000 to the organisation in 2013 to expand its HIV programs in sub-Saharan Africa.{{Cite news|url=https://online.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052702303763804579186013306479276|title=Music to Get in the Mood for Giving|last=Heyman|first=Marshall|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal|issn=0099-9660|access-date=6 March 2016}}{{Cite web|url=http://themusicuniverse.com/keep-a-child-alives-10th-annual-black-ball-raises-4-million-for-hiv-treatment/|title=Keep A Child Alive's 10th Annual Black Ball raises $4 million for HIV treatment {{!}} The Music Universe|website=The Music Universe|language=en-US|access-date=6 March 2016}} Low committed US$25 million over 15 years to the humanitarian news service [[IRIN]] on behalf of the Jynwel Foundation in November 2014, a step intended to fill a funding gap after the United Nations Office for Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs withdrew support in 2014.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/12/01/business/media/ailing-un-news-service-gets-25-million.html|title=Ailing U.N. News Service Gets $25 Million|last=Cumming-bruce|first=Nick|date=30 November 2014|newspaper=The New York Times|issn=0362-4331|access-date=6 March 2016}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2014/nov/20/irin-humanitarian-news-service-saved-after-private-donor-fills-un-void|title=Irin humanitarian news service saved after private donor fills UN void|last=Hatcher|first=Jessica|date=20 November 2014|newspaper=The Guardian|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077|access-date=6 March 2016}} == References == {{reflist|2}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Low, Jho}} [[Category:Malaysian philanthropists]] [[Category:1981 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Fugitives wanted by Malaysia]] [[Category:Malaysian people of Chinese descent]] [[Category:Malaysian businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Penang]] [[Category:People educated at Harrow School]] [[Category:Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania alumni]] [[Category:Political scandals in Malaysia]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person |birth_date={{birth date|1947|4|5}} |birth_place=[[Calgary]], [[Alberta]] |death_date={{Death date and age|2014|10|30|1947|4|5}} |death_place=[[Palm Springs, California]], U.S. |alma_mater=[[Utah State University]] |occupation=football player, owner, businessman |nationality=[[Canadians|Canadian]] |module= {{Infobox CFL player |embed=yes |name=John Forzani |full_name= |team=Calgary Stampeders |image= |ImageWidth= |caption= |status= |import= |position1=Owner|position2=[[Offensive lineman|OL]] |number= 54 |College= |high_school= |Height_ft= |Height_in= |Weight_lbs= |CFLDraftedYear= |CFLDraftedRound= |CFLDraftedPick= |CFLDraftedTeam= |other_title=business owner |other_years1=1974–2014 |other_team1=[[FGL Sports]] |administrating_years1=2005–2012 |administrating_team1=[[Calgary Stampeders]] (co-owner) |playing_years1=1971–1976 |playing_team1=Calgary Stampeders |career_highlights= |CFLAllStar= |Awards= |Honours= |Records= }} }} '''John Forzani''' (April 5, 1947 – October 30,<ref>I was there</ref> 2014) was a [[Canadians|Canadian]] businessman, former [[Canadian Football League]] (CFL) player, and CFL team owner. He was the Chairman and co-founder of [[FGL Sports]].
==Early life== Born in [[Calgary]], [[Alberta]], he received a degree in business administration from [[Utah State University]] in 1971. In 1971, he joined the [[Calgary Stampeders]] as an [[offensive lineman]] and was part of the winning team of the [[59th Grey Cup]]. He played football until 1976.<ref name="CdnBiz">{{cite web|url=http://www.canadianbusiness.com/lifestyle/article.jsp?content=20050829_70341_70341|title=Live And Learn: John Forzani|work=Canadian Business Online|accessdate=2010-11-24}}{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
==Career== In 1974, he opened a {{convert|1200|sqft|m2|adj=on}} store called Forzani's Locker Room in Calgary. In 1994, he acquired Sports Experts Inc. for $20 million becoming Canada's largest sporting goods retailer.<ref name="CdnBiz"/>
In 2001, the [[Retail Council of Canada]] recognized Forzani's work in leading FGL Sports (then known as the Forzani Group) to outstanding business success. In recognition of this accomplishment he was presented with the [[Distinguished Canadian Retailer of the Year|Distinguished Canadian Retailer of the Year Award]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stampeders.com/team/exec_committee/profile/?id=23|title=JOHN FORZANI, Chairman|work=Calgary Stampeders|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100824184340/http://www.stampeders.com/team/exec_committee/profile/?id=23|archivedate=2010-08-24|df=}}</ref>
In 2005, he became a part owner of the Calgary Stampeders.<ref name="CdnBiz"/> In June 2005, Concordia University conferred an honorary doctorate at the convocation ceremony for the John Molson School of Business, and he gave the address to the graduates.
==Personal== John and two of his brothers, [[Joe Forzani|Joe]] and [[Tom Forzani|Tom]], all played together with the Calgary Stampeders.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.calgarysun.com/2014/11/04/late-calgary-legend-john-forzanis-brain-to-be-donated-for-research | title=Late Calgary legend John Forzani's brain to be donated for research | publisher=calgarysun.com | date=November 4, 2014 | accessdate=December 1, 2014 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141224042031/http://www.calgarysun.com/2014/11/04/late-calgary-legend-john-forzanis-brain-to-be-donated-for-research | archive-date=2014-12-24 | dead-url=yes | df= }}</ref> Joe and Tom also attended Utah State University.<ref>http://www.utahstateaggies.com/sports/m-footbl/spec-rel/111102aad.html</ref> Forzani died of a heart attack on October 30, 2014.<ref>https://www.theglobeandmail.com/sports/football/former-calgary-stampeder-john-forzani-dies-after-heart-attack-in-california/article21403375/</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.cflapedia.com/Players/f/forzani_joe.htm CFLapedia bio]
{{59th Grey Cup}} {{StampedersOwners}}

revision.comment: Added Brockenbrough's participation in a committee calling for a "White Man's party" and whites-only suffrage
revision.text:
'''John White Brockenbrough''' (December 23, 1806 – February 20, 1877) was a Virginia lawyer, [[United States federal judge|federal judge]], educator, and the founder of the Lexington Law School, now known as [[Washington and Lee University School of Law]]. ==Biography== Brockenbrough was born in [[Hanover County, Virginia]]. His parents were [[William Brockenbrough (jurist)|William Brockenbrough]] and [[Judith Brockenbrough|Judith Robinson White Brockenbrough]]. His sister was [[Judith White Brockenbrough McGuire]], who wrote ''Diary of a Southern Refugee, During the War, By a Lady of Virginia''. He was a first cousin of [[William Henry Brockenbrough]]. He attended the [[College of William and Mary]] and the [[University of Virginia]] before he studied at the [[Winchester Law School]] under [[Henry St. George Tucker, Sr.|Henry St. George Tucker]]. Others studying with Tucker at that time included [[William L. Goggin]] and [[Henry A. Wise]].{{cite web|url=http://www.historycooperative.org/journals/lhr/21.2/note_bryson.html#FOOT57|title=The Winchester Law School, 1824–1831, by W. Hamilton Bryson and E. Lee Shepard|publisher=Law & History Review|accessdate=October 5, 2007 }} Brockenbrough was born in [[Hanover County, Virginia]] and served briefly as Commonwealth's Attorney for Hanover County. In 1837, he published two volumes of reports, containing the decisions of [[John Marshall]]'s federal circuit court opinions. He was also the editor of the ''Lexington Valley Star'' in [[Rockbridge County, Virginia]]. Brockenbrough established the [[Washington and Lee University School of Law|Lexington Law School]] in 1849. His law students included [[John J. Davis (congressman)|John J. Davis]], [[John Goode]] and [[Robert Murphy Mayo]]. In his introductory address to the first class of incoming students, Brockenbrough offered this advice:
Sooner or later the occasion will arise when you will appear before the dread tribunal of the public. Let us suppose that the time for the trial of your strength has now arrived. You are called to participate in the management of a cause which excites a profound public interest. A natural curiosity is felt to hear the maiden speech of the young lawyer! People have scarcely yet learned to look upon you as a man. Little is therefore expected of you, but you have had time for preparation, and you have used it well. You have anticipated every possible phase which the case can assume, and you are ready with your authorities to sustain all your positions. The eager crowd closes around you. They listen with surprised delight at the display of your learning and ingenuity, now enraptured with your splendid bursts of indignant eloquence, now melted into pity by some master stroke of touching pathos. With what a greedy ear they drink in those "words that burn, those thoughts that breathe!" You sit down overpowered by your own emotion. An audible murmer of approbation runs through that delighted throng! The cause is ended, the victory is won! Clients now pour in upon you, who before had none. You have made a great impression. Your reputation is now established on a firm basis, and the voice of hissing envy shall not retard your onward march. My friends, this is no fancy sketch. We are told by Mr. Butler in his "Reminiscences," that a celebrated English lawyer of the last century had said, that so sudden was his rise at the Bar, that he never knew the difference between having no income at all, and one of £3,000 sterling a year. A single great speech had established his reputation on an imperishable foundation. Who shall say that a like brilliant destiny may not be reserved for some of you, in the unwritten history of the future?{{cite web|url=http://law.wlu.edu/faculty/history/brockenbrough/address.htm|title=Introductory Address, October 31, 1949|publisher=Washington & Lee University|accessdate=October 5, 2007 }}
In 1852, Brockenbrough was elected to the board of trustees of what is now [[Washington and Lee University|Washington & Lee University]] (then Washington College), which had previously honored him with a Doctor of Laws degree in 1851.{{cite web|url=http://registrar.wlu.edu/honors/hondegs.htm|title=Honorary degrees conferred, by date of award|publisher=Washington & Lee University|accessdate=January 27, 2008 }} As Rector from 1865–1872, he was the one to approach [[Robert E. Lee]] with the trustees' proposal to make Lee president of the College. Brockenbrough was nominated by [[James K. Polk]] on December 23, 1845, to the seat vacated by [[Isaac S. Pennybacker]] on the [[United States District Court for the Western District of Virginia]]. He was confirmed by the [[United States Senate]] on January 14, 1846, and received commission the same day. He was also a professor of law at [[Washington and Lee University School of Law|Lexington Law School]], Lexington, Virginia, from 1849 to 1861. Along with [[John Tyler]], [[William C. Rives]], [[James Seddon]], and [[George W. Summers]], Brockenbrough represented Virginia at the [[peace conference of 1861]]. When the War began, Brockenbrough resigned from his judicial position. [[Abraham Lincoln]] nominated [[John Jay Jackson, Jr.]], to replace Brockenbrough in the Western District in 1861. During the War, Judge Brockenbrough served as the Confederate district judge for Western Virginia, and was a member of the [[Congress of the Confederate States]]. After the War, he returned to teaching law. In 1866, [[Robert E. Lee]], as president of [[Washington and Lee University|Washington College]], invited Judge Brockenbrough to join his Lexington Law School with Washington College, and continue to teach as Professor of Law and Equity.{{cite web|url=http://law2.wlu.edu/news/page.asp?pageid=351|title=School of Law Overview :: News :: W&L Law School|publisher=Washington & Lee University|accessdate=September 24, 2007 }} In 1868, Brockenbrough was a member of a five-man committee in Lexington which called for "a White Man's party, based on the single principal [sic] that the white man alone has the right to vote."{{cite news |last1=Harwood |first1=Doug |title=Elections of 1867 and '68 were as ugly as it gets |work=Rockbridge Advocate |issue=October 2018 |ref=advocate201810}} In 1870, [[John Randolph Tucker (Virginia politician)|John Randolph Tucker]], son of [[Henry St. George Tucker, Sr.|Henry St. George Tucker]], was hired to teach law along with Brockenbrough. Brockenbrough resigned in 1873, in a dispute over salary. He died four years later in Lexington, at the age of seventy. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Sources== * {{FJC Bio|268|nid=1378306|name=John White Brockenbrough}} * [http://law.wlu.edu/faculty/history/brockenbrough Judge John White Brockenbrough Founder of Washington and Lee Law School] * Hon. Armistead M. Dobie, "Federal District Judges in Virginia before the Civil War," 12 F.R.D. 451 (1951,1952) (viewed on Westlaw) {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Brockenbrough, John White}} [[Category:1806 births]] [[Category:1877 deaths]] [[Category:Virginia lawyers]] [[Category:Judges of the United States District Court for the Western District of Virginia]] [[Category:Judges of the Confederate States]] [[Category:United States federal judges appointed by James K. Polk]] [[Category:19th-century American judges]] [[Category:College of William & Mary alumni]] [[Category:University of Virginia alumni]] [[Category:Washington and Lee University School of Law faculty]] [[Category:Washington and Lee University trustees]] [[Category:People from Hanover County, Virginia]] [[Category:Founders of educational institutions]] [[Category:Brockenbrough family of Virginia]] [[Category:People from Lexington, Virginia]]

{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{BLP sources|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox person |name = Khadija Mushtaq |image = |caption = |birth_name = |birth_date = 23 August 1968 |birth_place = Pakistan |residence = [[Rawalpindi]], Pakistan |nationality = Pakistani |other_names = |citizenship = Pakistani |alma_mater = [[University of London]]
[[Quaid-i-Azam University]] |occupation = Teacher, Student Counselor, entrepreneur |years_active = |employer = |title = Executive director of [[Roots School System]]; [[patron]] of Environment Pakistan |term = |predecessor = |successor = |party = |opponents = |boards = Roots School System |parents = |awards = |signature = |footnotes = |achievements = }} '''Khadija Mushtaq''' is a Pakistani Business woman and entrepreneur who serves as executive director of [[Roots School System]] and principal of its DHA-1 campus. She is the [[CO2|CEO]] of Roots Ivy International Schools and the [[chancellor]] of [[Roots Ivy International University]].{{cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/688472/colonial-catch-saga-of-unfamiliar-sounds/|title=Proficiency in English Crucial- Khadija Mushtaq|publisher=Tribune.com.pk|accessdate=8 November 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-6-181685-An-interview-with-Khadija-Mushtaq|title= An interview with Khadija Mushtaq|date=4 June 2013|work=The News International, Pakistan|accessdate=8 November 2014}} She has worked to revolutionize the concept of education.{{Cite web|url=https://www.thenews.com.pk/magazine/you/103491-Say-yes-to-women-power|title=Say yes to women power|last=Muzaffar|first=Erum Noor|website=www.thenews.com.pk|language=en|access-date=2018-03-03}} She represented Pakistan at the University of New York national Programmes Global Symposium in 1992.{{cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/696066/stand-outs-roots-dha-school-celebrates-world-toppers/|title=Stand outs: Roots DHA school celebrates world toppers|publisher=Tribune.com.pk|accessdate=8 November 2014}}{{not in citation|date=March 2018}} ==Personal life== Khadija Mushtaq was born on 23 August 1968. Her father was a [[colonel]] in the [[Pakistan Army]]. In 1988, her mother, Riffat Mushtaq, founded Roots School System on Harley Street in [[Rawalpindi]]. Khadija Mushtaq earned her [[Bachelor of Science]] in economics, statistics, and mathematics from the [[University of London]]. She then completed [[Master of Economics]] degree from [[Quaid-i-Azam University]]. She received an honorary doctorate degree from [[BPP University]] and has received many awards for her work in education.{{Cite news|url=https://nation.com.pk/15-Jan-2017/khadija-mushtaq-awarded-honorary-doctorate-degree|title=Khadija Mushtaq awarded honorary doctorate degree|work=The Nation|access-date=2018-03-03|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://pakobserver.net/khadija-mushtaq-awarded-honorary-doctorate-degree/|title=Khadija Mushtaq awarded Honorary Doctorate Degree - PakObserver|last=Webmaster|date=2017-01-14|work=PakObserver|access-date=2018-03-03|language=en-US}} She launched and became the head of the University of London International Programme at Roots. She was then named [[Principal (academia)|principal]] of the largest Roots campus, in defance Housing Authority, Islamabad. She is married and has two children, one of who studies in the Roots Ivy International School.{{cite web|url=http://pakobserver.net/201403/08/detailnews.asp?id=235691 |title=Khadija Mushtaq: A woman of substance, an Icon for youth |publisher=Pakobserver.net |accessdate=8 November 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006103007/http://pakobserver.net/201403/08/detailnews.asp?id=235691 |archivedate= 6 October 2014 |df= }} ==Career== Mushtaq gained popularity because of the high achievement level of her students: In the 2011–2012 academic year, her students received more than 1.6 billion [[Rupee|rupees]] worth of scholarships. She has worked closely with the [[Ministry of Education (Malaysia)|Ministry of Education of Malaysia]] and is a female empowerment activist and patron in chief of several [[NGO]]s, including Liberating the Girl Child Foundation and Environment Pakistan. Along with her and parents, she owns Roots School System, the third-largest private school chain in [[Pakistan]].{{citation needed|date=August 2012}} Some of her most notable students are [[Ali Moeen Nawazish]] (known for passing 23 [[A-level|A-levels]]), Samad Khurram, and Danish Shabbir (who received 23 A grades in the [[International General Certificate of Secondary Education]]). Hundreds of her students are studying at top global universities, including [[Oxford University]], [[Duke University]], the [[University of London]], the [[University of British Columbia]], [[New York University]], [[Stanford University]], [[Princeton University]], [[Yale University]], [[Cornell University]], [[Brown University]], and the [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]] (MIT).{{cite web |url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/362743/24th-anniversary-roots-flaunts-rs1-625-billion-in-scholarships/ |title=24th Anniversary: Roots flaunts Rs1.625 billion in scholarships – The Express Tribune |publisher=Tribune.com.pk |date=11 April 2012 |accessdate=30 August 2012}} Mushtaq received the Yale Educator Award in 2009 and the Best Councillor Award from MIT in 2010. She is a member of the National Society of High School Scholars and the Overseas Career Counsellor Association. She is an honorary member of the Cambridge Advisory Council, the top forum for educators in Pakistan. She received the Claus Nobel Educator of Distinction award from the National Society of High School Scholars, and the Counsellor's Award from [[Richmond University]] and New York University.{{cite web|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-6-113691-Education-real-investment-in-a-child-says-Khadija |title=Education real investment in a child, says Khadija |publisher=Thenews.com.pk |date= |accessdate=30 August 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.rotaryclubrawalpindi.org/roots-interact-students-sow-the-seeds-of-joy-and-hope|title=Roots Interact Students – Sow the Seeds of Joy and Hope|publisher=Rotaryclubrawalpindi.org|accessdate=8 November 2014}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.khadijamushtaq.org.pk Official website] *[http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-6-102713-Roots-holds-award-ceremony-for-high-achievers Roots holds award ceremony for high-achievers – thenews.com.pk] {{DEFAULTSORT:Mushtaq, Khadija}} [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of London International Programmes]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of London]] [[Category:Pakistani businesspeople]] [[Category:Pakistani schoolteachers]] [[Category:Quaid-i-Azam University alumni]] [[Category:Recipients of Tamgha-e-Imtiaz]]

{{EngvarB|date=May 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2013}} The '''King Report on Corporate Governance''' is a ground-breaking booklet of guidelines for the governance structures and operation of companies in South Africa. It is issued by the King Committee on Corporate Governance. Three reports were issued in 1994 (King I), 2002 (King II), and 2009 (King III) and a fourth revision (King IV) in 2016. The Institute of Directors in Southern Africa (IoDSA) owns the copyright of the King Report on Corporate Governance and the King Code of Corporate Governance. Compliance with the King Reports is a requirement for companies listed on the [[JSE Limited|Johannesburg Stock Exchange]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.naspers.com/corp-gov-application-approach-king.php |title=Application of and approach to King III |publisher=[[Naspers]] |accessdate=4 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110823004626/http://naspers.com/corp-gov-application-approach-king.php |archivedate=23 August 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.omnia.co.za/pebble.asp?relid=1879 |title=Corporate Governance |publisher=Omnia |accessdate=4 August 2011}}</ref> The King Report on Corporate Governance has been cited as "the most effective summary of the best international practices in corporate governance".<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=MQD4CmMa1tgC&pg=PA317&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=7Kc6To3VMIOw8gPa05DmAg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CDQQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title=Management: Fresh perspectives |page=317 |first=Steve |last=Banhegyi |publisher=Pearson Education South Africa |year=2007|isbn=978-1-86891-594-1}}</ref>
==History== In July 1993 the Institute of Directors in South Africa asked retired [[Supreme Court of South Africa]] judge [[Mervyn King (judge)|Mervyn E. King]] to chair a committee on corporate governance. He viewed this as an opportunity to educate the newly democratic South African public on the working of a free economy.<ref name="int">{{cite web |url=http://www.insideinvestorrelations.com/articles/16371/audience-mervyn-king/ |title=An Audience with the GRI's King |last=Stewart |first=Neil |date=9 September 2010 |accessdate=4 August 2011 |publisher=Inside Investor Relations |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110113123908/http://www.insideinvestorrelations.com/articles/16371/audience-mervyn-king/ |archivedate=13 January 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The committee's report was to be the first report of its kind in South Africa.<ref name="hen">{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=croQAGwkNi8C&pg=PA339&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=7Kc6To3VMIOw8gPa05DmAg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=6&ved=0CEUQ6AEwBQ#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title=Business Governance Handbook: Principles and practice, Volume 1 |page=339 |last1=Hendrikse |first1=Dr. John W. |last2=Kendrikse |first2=Leigh |publisher=Juta Academic |year=2004 |isbn=0-7021-6499-2}}</ref>
Committee members included Phillip Armstrong, Nigel Payne, and Richard Wilkinson.
==Approach == Unlike other corporate governance codes such as Sarbanes-Oxley, the code is non-legislative and is based on principles and practices. It also espouses an apply or explain approach, unique to the Netherlands until King and now also found in the 2010 Combined Code from the United Kingdom.
The philosophy of the code consists of the three key elements of leadership, sustainability and good corporate citizenship. It views good governance as essentially being effective, ethical leadership. King believes that leaders should direct the company to achieve sustainable economic, social and environmental performance. It views sustainability as the primary moral and economic imperative of this century; the code's view on corporate citizenship flows from a company's standing as a juristic person under the South African constitution and should operate in a sustainable manner.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iodsa.co.za/PRODUCTSSERVICES/KingIIIReportPapersGuidelines/KingReportonCorporateGovernanceinSA/KingIII.aspx |title=King 3 Code of Corporate Governance for South Africa |publisher=Institute of Directors in Southern Africa |year=2009 |accessdate=3 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120503104127/http://www.iodsa.co.za/PRODUCTSSERVICES/KingIIIReportPapersGuidelines/KingReportonCorporateGovernanceinSA/KingIII.aspx |archivedate= 3 May 2012 |df= }}</ref>
==King I== In 1994 the first King report on corporate governance (King 1) was published, the first corporate governance code for South Africa. It established recommended standards of conduct for boards and directors of listed companies, banks, and certain state-owned enterprises. It included not only financial and regulatory aspects, but also advocated an integrated approach that involved all stakeholders.<ref name="cliff">{{cite web| url=http://www.mervynking.co.za/downloads/CD_King2.pdf |title=King Report on Corporate Governance for South Africa 2002 – What it means to you|publisher=Cliff Dekker Attorneys |year=2002 |accessdate=3 April 2012}}</ref>
It was applicable to all companies listed on the main board of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, large public entities as defined by the Public Entities Act of South Africa; banks, financial and insurance companies as defined by the Financial Services Acts of South Africa; and large unlisted companies. It defined "large" as companies with shareholder equity over R50 million, but encouraged all companies to adopt the code.
The key principles from the first King report covered: * Board of directors makeup and mandate, including the role of non-executive directors and guidance on the categories of people who should make up the non-executive directors * Appointments to the board and guidance on the maximum term for executive directors * Determination and disclosure of executive and non-executive director’s remuneration * Board meeting frequency * Balanced annual reporting * The requirement for effective auditing * Affirmative action programs * The company’s code of ethics <ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.ecgi.org/codes/documents/king_i_sa.pdf |title=The code of corporate practices and conduct, an extract from the King Report on Corporate Governance|publisher=The Institute of Directors of Southern Africa |year=1994 |accessdate=4 April 2012}}</ref>
==King II== In 2002, when the [[Earth Summit 2002|Earth Summit]] was held in Johannesburg, King pushed for a revision of the report (King II), including new sections on [[sustainability]],<ref name="int"/> the role of the corporate board,<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RGmHAVPhmRwC&pg=PA298&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=GKw6Tp3NEYmh8QOn_u3zCA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=9&ved=0CE8Q6AEwCDgK#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title=Corporate Governance |first1=Robert A. G. |last1=Monks |first2=Nell |last2=Minow |page=298 |publisher=Wiley-Blackwell |year=2003 |isbn=1-4051-1698-6}}</ref> and [[risk management]].<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=9end-Uoo8_gC&pg=PA17&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=GKw6Tp3NEYmh8QOn_u3zCA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CDwQ6AEwBDgK#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title=The Executives Guide to Insurance and Risk Management |page=17 |first=Graeme |last=Berwick |publisher=Quality Results Pty Limited |year=2007}}</ref> This revised code of governance was applicable from March 2002.
In addition to those types of organizations listed in King I, it was applicable to departments of State or national, provincial or local government administration falling under the Local Government: Municipal Finance Management Act, and public institution or functionary exercising a power or performing a function in terms of the constitution, or exercising a public power or performing a public function in terms of any legislation, excluding courts or judicial officers. As before, it encourages all companies to adopt the applicable principles from the code.<ref name="King2Final">{{cite web| url=http://library.ufs.ac.za/dl/userfiles/documents/Information_Resources/KingII%20Final%20doc.pdf |title=King Report on Corporate Governance for South Africa 2002|publisher=Institute of Directors in Southern Africa |year=2002 |accessdate=4 April 2012}}</ref>
The key principles from the second King report covered the following areas: * Directors and their responsibility * Risk management * Internal audit * Integrated sustainability reporting * Accounting and auditing<ref name="King2Final"/>
===Legislative Enforcement===
As before, the code is not enforced through legislation. However, it co-exists with a number of laws that apply to companies and directors including the Companies Act. In addition further enforcement takes place by regulations such as the JSE Securities Exchange Listings Requirements.<ref name="King2Final"/>
==King III== In an interview with Mervin King, he considered the King II report was wrong to include sustainability as a separate chapter, leading companies to report on it separately from other factors. In the next version, the 2009 King III report,<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=woqEDQQzGp0C&pg=PT365&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=-Yg6TtTiDoiZ8QOlzJCKAw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCgQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title= The A to Z of Corporate Social Responsibility |last1=Visser |first1=Wayne |last2=Matten |first2=Dirk |last3=Pohl |first3=Manfred |last4=Tolhurst |first4=Nick|isbn=978-0-470-68650-8}}</ref> governance, strategy and sustainability were integrated.<ref name="int"/> The report recommends that organisations produce an integrated report in place of an annual financial report and a separate sustainability report and that companies create sustainability reports according to the Global Reporting Initiative's Sustainability Reporting Guidelines.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.saica.co.za/tabid/695/itemid/2344/language/en-ZA/An-integrated-report-is-a-new-requirement-for-list.aspx |title=An integrated report is a new requirement for listed companies |publisher=South African Institute of Chartered Accountants |date=4 June 2010 |accessdate=8 August 2011}}</ref>
In contrast to the earlier versions, King III is applicable to all entities, public, private and non-profit. King encourages all entities to adopt the King III principles and explain how these have been applied or are not applicable. The code of governance was applicable from March 2010.<ref name="King3">{{cite web| url=http://www.library.up.ac.za/law/docs/king111report.pdf |title=King Report on Corporate Governance for South Africa 2009 |publisher=Institute of Directors in Southern Africa |year=2009 |accessdate=5 April 2012}}</ref>
The report incorporated a number of global emerging governance trends: * Alternative dispute resolution * Risk-based internal audit * Shareholder approval of non-executive directors’ remuneration * Evaluation of board and directors’ performance<ref name="King3"/>
It also incorporated a number of new principles to address elements not previously included in the King reports: * IT governance * Business Rescue * Fundamental and affected transactions in terms of director’s responsibilities during mergers, acquisitions and amalgamations.<ref name="King3"/>
Again, the code of corporate governance is not enforced through legislation. However, due to evolutions in South African law many of the principles put forward in King II are now embodied as law in the Companies Act of South Africa of 2008. In addition to the Companies Act, there are additional applicable statutes that encapsulate some of the principles of King III such as the Public Finance Management Act and the Promotion of Access to Information Act.<ref name="King3"/>
*[[Integrated reporting]] *[http://www.unpri.org The Unites Nations Global Compact and the Principles for Responsible Investment] *[http://www.oecd.org/daf/investment/guidelines OECD Guidelines for Multinational Companies] *[https://www.globalreporting.org/reporting/latest-guidelines/g3-guidelines/Pages/default.aspx Global Reporting Initiative’s G3 guidelines] *[[Companies Act 2006|The United Kingdom Companies Act of 2006]]
==King IV== "There have been significant corporate governance and regulatory developments, locally and internationally, since King III was issued in 2009 which need to be taken into account. The other consideration is that whilst listed companies are generally applying King III, non-profit organisations, private companies and entities in the public sector have experienced challenges in interpreting and adapting King III to their particular circumstances. The enhancement will aim to make King IV more accessible to all types of entities across sectors."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://c.ymcdn.com/sites/www.iodsa.co.za/resource/collection/16F4503D-86F9-43D5-AEB4-C067B06EB59C/Guide_to_questions_and_answers_on_King_IV.pdf |title=Guide to questions and answers on King IV |publisher=Institute of Directors in Southern Africa |accessdate=7 March 2016}}</ref>
King IV was published on 1 November 2016.<ref>{{cite web|last1=The King Committee|title=Report on Corporate Governance for South Africa|url=https://c.ymcdn.com/sites/www.iodsa.co.za/resource/resmgr/king_iv/King_IV_Report/IoDSA_King_IV_Report_-_WebVe.pdf|accessdate=19 July 2017}}</ref> Providing for a 2-year period in respect of the drafting process and another year grace period to allow organisations to implement, King IV will probably become effective from middle 2017.
The Institute of Directors in Southern Africa (IoDSA) <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iodsa.co.za/general/custom.asp?page=kingIV |title=King IV |publisher=Institute of Directors in Southern Africa |accessdate=7 March 2016}}</ref> is the custodian of the King reports and the holder of their copyrights. Ansie Ramalho from the IoDSA, with the assistance of Parmi Natesan and Julie Dixon, leads the project management of the redrafting process and serves as the editor of the various drafts. The King Committee governs the drafting process and will ultimately approve of the King IV Report.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links==
[[Category:Economy of South Africa]] [[Category:Corporate governance]]

revision.comment: added [[Category:Foresters]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
[[File:"People from Price County, Wisconsin".jpg|thumb|Leo Heikkinen in 1960]] '''Leo Leonard Heikkinen''' (born June 11, 1917)<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://www.apg-wi.com/ashland_daily_press/obituaries/leo-heikkinen/article_e6b67f42-952d-57be-bc91-4b9bdec99ee8.html|title=Leo Heikkinen|work=APG of Wisconsin|access-date=2018-08-31|language=en}}</ref> was an American entrepreneur and millionaire who founded and owned numerous forestry production companies in Prentice, WI, including Prentice Hydraulics, Inc. (now a division of Caterpillar, Inc.)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.caterpillar.com/en/company/brands/prentice.html|title=Caterpillar {{!}} Prentice|website=www.caterpillar.com|language=en|access-date=2018-08-31}}</ref> and Multitek North America, LLC.<ref name=":0" /> He is credited for inventing the "knuckleboom" hydraulic loader,<ref>{{cite book|title=The Northern Logger and Timber Processor|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bST0AAAAMAAJ|year=2003|publisher=Northeastern Loggers' Association}}</ref><ref name="CarterKellison2015">{{cite book|author1=Mason C. Carter|author2=Robert C. Kellison|author3=R. Scott Wallinger|title=Forestry in the U.S. South: A History|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Zx-MCgAAQBAJ&pg=PT459|date=9 November 2015|publisher=LSU Press|isbn=978-0-8071-6056-5|pages=459–}}</ref> an invention that propelled the Prentice loader to 51% of the worldwide market.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Monte|first=Mike|date=November 2017|title=Early Leo Heikkinen Loader on Display in Price County Museum|url=|journal=Great Lakes Timber Producer's Association|volume=|pages=|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=|title=The Legacy of a Local Leader|last=Peterson|first=Cathy|date=September 30, 1999|work=Price County Bee|access-date=}}</ref>
=== Family Life and Education === Heikkinen was born the third child in a family of ten in Brantwood, WI. He graduated from Tripoli High School in 1935,<ref name=":0" /> married his wife Norma in 1941,<ref name=":0" /> worked in Milwaukee, WI for the Koehring Company,<ref name=":1">{{Cite journal|last=Wester|first=Dave|date=February 1998|title=A Kind and Generous Industrialist|url=|journal=The Timber Producer|volume=|pages=|via=}}</ref> and returned to Price County in 1945<ref name=":0" /> where he made the town of Prentice his home. Heikkinen had four children with his wife Norma.<ref name=":0" /> He died on Friday, Sept. 10, 1999.<ref name=":0" />
=== Prentice Hydraulics, Inc. === In 1959, after running Heikkinen Machine Shop with his brothers for over a decade, Heikkinen incorporated Prentice Hydraulics.<ref name=":1" /> With Prentice Hydraulics, Heikkinen excelled due to selling his knuckleboom loader, a revolutionary design for pulpwood loaders that allowed a single operator to load a truck through a design that featured essentially a “yo-yo” and “claw” versus manually wrapping logs with a cable or worse, loading the logs by hand.<ref name=":2">{{Cite journal|last=Monte|first=Mike|date=July 2015|title=Leo Heikkinen Honored by Price County Development Association|url=|journal=Great Lakes Timber Professionals Association|volume=|pages=|via=}}</ref> The company began with 35 employees and grew to 340 employees and $9 million in sales prior to its sale to Omark Industries in 1967.<ref name=":1" />
=== Multitek North America, LLC === In 1970, Heikkinen founded Multitek North America, LLC which focused primarily on machines to process firewood, conveyors, wheel-crusher and attachments for skid steers.<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=http://www.apg-wi.com/price_county_review/news/business/heikkinen-selected-for-lifetime-achievement-award/article_f3b978b0-f9c1-11e4-ba00-d392083eb8c7.html|title=Heikkinen selected for 2015 Lifetime Achievement Award|work=APG of Wisconsin|access-date=2018-08-31|language=en}}</ref> Multitek was in the Heikkinen family (first owned and operated by Leo and then by his three sons) until 2006 when it was sold to a Wisconsin-based investment group.<ref name=":4">{{Cite news|url=http://www.apg-wi.com/price_county_review/news/business/investors-group-acquires-multitek-inc/article_f4dea91a-57f7-504a-95ec-e94f0d3ec575.html|title=Investors group acquires Multitek Inc.|last=Peterson|first=Cathy|work=APG of Wisconsin|access-date=2018-08-31|language=en}}</ref> Doug Kamps became the first President of Multitek North America, LLC under the new owners.<ref name=":4" />
=== Charity === Heikkinen was heavily involved in community projects around Prentice, WI. His donations included a community center, community park and pond, high school athletic fields, lights and equipment, a house for the town’s first doctor, land for the village’s first dental office. He also built and donated the Village of Prentice Municipal Golf Course and the Village of Prentice Airport.<ref name=":3" /> Heikkinen served as Village President for approximately 10 years while donating most of his pay back to the community.<ref name=":2" />
=== Awards ===
* Distinguished Finnish-American Award<ref name=":3" /> * Admired Senior Citizen Award<ref name=":3" /> * 1979 Wisconsin and Michigan Timber Producers Award<ref name=":3" /> * Northeastern Loggers Association 1996 Outstanding Service to the Forest Industry Award<ref name=":3" /> * Suomi College’s Distinguished Finnish American Award<ref name=":3" /> * 1999 Wisconsin Business Hall of Fame<ref name=":0" /> * Wisconsin Business Hall of Fame Eagle Award<ref name=":3" /> * 2015 Price County Economic Development Association’s Lifetime Achievement Award<ref name=":3" />
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Businesspeople]] [[Category:Foresters]]

revision.comment: /* References */ fixed category
revision.text:
'''Louis Franklin Bache''' (7 October 1779 – 4 October 1818) was the son of [[Richard Bache]] and [[Sarah Franklin Bache]], the daughter of the American statesman [[Benjamin Franklin]] and his wife [[Deborah Read]]. Bache served as a lieutenant colonel in the Pennsylvania State Militia during the [[War of 1812]] between the United States and Great Britain.
Bache was the commander of a detachment of 351 men in the Pennsylvania State Militia Volunteers which was assigned by Pennsylvania Governor [[Simon Snyder]] to defend the City of Philadelphia against the British in the War of 1812. In October 1814, Lt. Col. Bache refused to submit to federal military takeover of his Pennsylvania State Militia detachment because his soldiers originally joined the state militia pursuant to a later-disputed agreement with U.S. Brigadier General [[Joseph Bloomfield]] that Bache's soldiers would always serve under their state (and not federal) militia officers.
Standing firm on principle, Bache and his five subordinate officers were arrested. Bache was court-martialed and was dismissed from U.S. military service. The military court decided not to punish Bache further because the court believed Bache's closing arguments...that he acted in good faith based upon Governor Snyder's orders, his motives were pure, and that trust was placed in him by his soldiers and the soldiers' parents who allowed their sons to volunteer only under the command of trusted state militia officers. The Bache court-martial case and the related U.S. Supreme Court case of ''United States v. Peters'' has been the subject of historical discussion regarding federal-state relations and balance of power.<ref>Citizen Soldiers in the War of 1812, Ch. 8, Federal-State Relations, p. 141, Vol. 1998, By Carl Edward Skeen.</ref>
==Marriage and family== Bache married Margaret Riley (1781–1806) in 1802. They had two children together: * Margaret Bache (1803–1871) * Louis Franklin Bache, Jr. (1805–1887)
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Benjamin Franklin}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bache, Louis Franklin}} [[Category:1779 births]] [[Category:1818 deaths]] [[Category:Pennsylvania militia]] [[Category:People who were court-martialed]] [[Category:Franklin family]]
